alert.note: Alert for Kankakee (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:07AM CST until January 29 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Indiana... Kankakee River at Momence affecting Kankakee County. Kankakee River at Shelby affecting Lake IN and Newton Counties. For the Kankakee River...including Shelby, Momence...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a combination of snowmelt and heavy river ice. * WHERE...Kankakee River from IL/IN state line downstream to confluence with Iroquois River at Aroma Park, including the Momence gauge. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Low-lying wetlands, forest land, and agricultural land inundated along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CST Sunday the stage was 4.6 feet. Kankakee County Emergency Management indicated shifting ice and multiple ice jams occurring along the Kankakee River from Kankakee upstream to near Sun River Terrace. Heavy river ice was observed farther upstream along the river. - Forecast...Shifting and breaking of river ice upstream may cause new ice jams and flooding. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Report flooding to the National Weather Service or your local law enforcement agency only when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 315 AM CST.
